item.title: Tylenol during pregnancy: No strong evidence ties use to autism or ADHD risk

item.title: Q&A: New tech helps Parkinson's patients who have trouble walking

item.title: Hospital patients who feel short of breath after being admitted are six times more likely to die, research finds
item.description: The risk of dying is six times higher among patients who become short of breath after being admitted to hospital, according to research published in E...

item.title: Eczema symptoms unchanged by daily or weekly bathing, study shows
item.description: A study has found that people with eczema are able to bathe either daily or weekly, without any impact on their symptoms.

item.title: Should kids be screened for high cholesterol genes? Study weighs costs and benefits
item.description: In the United States, 1 in every 250 people has inherited a genetic variant that leads to dangerously high cholesterol levels from birth.
